verbs.description: sentimentalize (third-person singular simple present sentimentalizes, present participle sentimentalizing, simple past and past participle sentimentalized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To give a sentimental feel to.
examples: Let us not sentimentalize things just because they are old. Getting all dewy-eyed about it because it was started in the 17th century doesn't make sense when we're talking about the town dump.

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To think or act in a sentimental manner, or like a sentimentalist; to affect exquisite sensibility.
examples: he learnt to sentimentalize over cathedrals and monasteries , pictures and statues , saints and kaisers
